alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lunenburg, Nottoway, northwestern Dinwiddie, southwestern Amelia and northwestern Brunswick Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blackstone. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blackstone, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, Nottoway, Lunenburg, Burkeville, Wilsons, Fort Pickett, Spainville, Dundas, Bacons Fork, North Wellville, Irby, Gills Corner, Murdocks, Forkland, Darvills, The Falls and Wellville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
